Content:: Cretaceous Research is a bimonthly peer-reviewed scientific journal published by Elsevier. The journal focuses on topics dealing with the Cretaceous period and the Cretaceous–Paleogene boundary. The journal is abstracted and indexed in Scopus and the Web of Science. According to the Journal Citation Reports, the journal has a 2020 impact factor of 2.176.[1]  This article about a journal on paleontology is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. See tips for writing articles about academic journals. Further suggestions might be found on the article's talk page. This article related to the Cretaceous period is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
